rainy_season_planting: May - July/August. Ideal for maize, guinea corn, rice, groundnuts, soybeans, and most staple crops.
dry_season_farming: November - February. Requires irrigation. Suitable for vegetables like tomatoes, peppers, onions, garden eggs, and leafy greens.
soil_fertility: Practice crop rotation, use organic fertilizers like compost or well-rotted animal manure. Regenerative agriculture practices are promoted.
pest_disease_control: Consult local agricultural extension workers at the Adamawa State Ministry of Agriculture office in Yola.
regenerative_agriculture: Over 20,000 farmers in Yola North, Girei, and Yola South LGAs trained as of June 2024.
adasp: Adamawa State Agricultural Development and Services Programme (ADAS-P) empowers farmers by boosting productivity, strengthening market access, enhancing financial stability, and promoting sustainable practices.
